tournament.name: Secret Lair Showdown Qualifier - Pastimes Events

decks.notes: This deck focuses on using ramp and land synergy to quickly set up powerful combos with Primeval Titan and The One Ring. By utilizing Amulet of Vigor, Arboreal Grazer, and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to generate a large amount of mana and tutor for key pieces to close out the game. The strategy revolves around efficiently searching and ramping lands, while also utilizing Malevolent Rumble and other spells for disruption and protection. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through explosive plays.

The deck focuses on combining aggressive creatures with life gain abilities to create a fast and resilient strategy. Cards like Martyr of Sands and White Orchid Phantom help gain life quickly, while cards like Solitude and Skyclave Apparition provide removal and disruption. The deck also includes cards like Abiding Grace and Temporary Lockdown to further control the board and protect your life total. The combination of aggressive creatures, life gain, and disruption creates a strong and versatile aggro strategy that can overwhelm opponents quickly.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to establish early board presence with aggressive creatures like Ocelot Pride and Amped Raptor, while also utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional power to push for a quick victory. The deck also utilizes Galvanic Discharge and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. By slowing down the opponent's strategy and out-valuing them with card advantage, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and ultimately win through incremental advantage. The deck also utilizes graveyard synergies with cards like Unearth and Murktide Regent to further improve its control capabilities and adapt to different matchups. Overall, the key strategy is to grind out the opponent and emerge victorious through careful decision-making and resource management.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and utilizing powerful spells to control the board. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds consistency and versatility to the deck. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah helps to pump up the team, while cards like Thoughtseize and Static Prison disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also benefits from powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and efficient removal spells like Galvanic Discharge. Overall, the deck aims to pressure the opponent quickly and efficiently to secure a victory.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on using fast and efficient creatures to put pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with removal spells and combat tricks. The deck also includes a companion, Jegantha, the Wellspring, to provide additional value. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls, along with powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison adds versatility and disruption to ensure victory in a one-on-one match.

The deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence with efficient creatures like Eagles of the North and White Orchid Phantom, while utilizing Martyr of Sands to gain life and stabilize against aggressive strategies. Ranger-Captain of Eos helps tutor key cards, while Abiding Grace and Temporary Lockdown provide protection and disruption. The deck also includes some control elements with Supreme Verdict and Skyclave Apparition. The mana base is designed to support the deck's game plan and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's plans by using strong removal spells like Fatal Push, Damnation, and Thoughtseize while also gaining card advantage through cards like Cling to Dust and Profane Tutor. The deck also utilizes powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to close out the game. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like The One Ring and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional value and versatility to outmaneuver opponents. The deck aims to control the board and win through a combination of disruption and powerful threats.

The Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive play, utilizing creatures with haste and direct damage spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes powerful enchantments like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional versatility and mana fixing. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to apply consistent pressure on the opponent while maintaining control of the battlefield with a mix of creatures and spells.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay with cards like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls to quickly build a threatening board presence. The inclusion of cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury adds a powerful late-game threat. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Static Prison and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Blood Moon. The use of companions, like Jegantha, the Wellspring, adds an extra layer of versatility to the deck. Overall, this deck is designed to apply constant pressure and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures and spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total, while also controlling the board with cards like Static Prison. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion allows for additional consistency and flexibility in the deck. The deck also includes a variety of ways to deal direct damage to the opponent, such as Lightning Bolt and Goblin Bombardment. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on using creatures and spells to create a powerful combo that can win the game without the need for lands. By utilizing cards like Hydroelectric Specimen and Tameshi, Reality Architect, along with counter spells like Disrupting Shoal and Pact of Negation, players can control the board while setting up a win condition with cards like Goblin Charbelcher. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan, ultimately securing a victory through a landless strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of powerful creatures and spells to create a winning strategy without relying on traditional lands. By utilizing cards like Hydroelectric Specimen and Thundertrap Trainer, along with spells like Disrupting Shoal and Pact of Negation, the deck aims to quickly build up a board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention for additional mana and card advantage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its unique and efficient combos.

The main idea of this deck is to control the board through powerful removal spells like Supreme Verdict and Solitude, while utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Wrenn and Six to gain card advantage. The deck also aims to utilize The One Ring in order to gain an advantage over opponents by controlling the tempo of the game. Additionally, the deck includes powerful creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to close out the game quickly once the opponent's resources have been exhausted. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all colors of mana needed for the deck's spells.

This Control - UrzaTron deck focuses on using powerful Eldrazi creatures and artifacts to control the game while assembling the Urza lands to generate a large amount of colorless mana. By utilizing cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up devastating plays with cards like All Is Dust and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck's synergy between the Urza lands and Eldrazi creatures allows for a strong late-game presence and the ability to quickly close out games.

This deck focuses on fast-paced aggression, utilizing a variety of creatures with strong stats and abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of powerful creatures, removal spells, and support cards, the goal is to establish board presence early and maintain pressure throughout the game. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of versatility and consistency to the deck. By efficiently deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to secure victory before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to quickly ramp into Primeval Titan and other powerful creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The main goal is to search for key lands like Urza's Saga and Urza's Cave using cards like Expedition Map and Tolaria West to create a strong board presence. The deck also includes cards like Scapeshift and The One Ring to help close out the game or search for specific cards. Additionally, cards like Aftermath Analyst and Lumra, Bellow of the Woods provide additional value and card advantage to maintain board control.

The focus of this Boros Aggro Modern deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge, the deck aims to close out games quickly. Static Prison helps control the opponent's board while cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional threats. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a Companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck's game plan.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Amped Raptor, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish the game quickly. The inclusion of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Galvanic Discharge provides additional burst damage potential, while Static Prison helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The main strategy revolves around building a strong board presence and utilizing creature synergy to push for victory. The addition of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds versatility to the deck's overall game plan.

The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive Boros strategy focused on efficient creatures and burn spells. The key is to maintain constant pressure on the opponent while utilizing removal and disruptive elements to control the board. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds additional flexibility and power to the deck. Overall, the main goal is to quickly establish a strong board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on using the Underworld Breach combo to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, generating value and eventually winning the game by milling the opponent using Grinding Station and Emry, Lurker of the Loch. It runs efficient cheap spells and artifacts that can be easily recurred with Breach, while also generating mana with Mox Amber and Urza's Saga. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Spell Snare and Unholy Heat.

The deck focuses on ramping up Eldrazi creatures quickly with cards like Through the Breach and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. It also incorporates control elements with cards like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures while maintaining control of the game through removal and disruption spells. The inclusion of The One Ring adds an additional win condition and helps to support the overall strategy of the deck.

This deck focuses on using ramp spells like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to quickly accelerate mana production in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Breaker of Creation. Control elements like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble help to disrupt opponents while Kozilek's Return provides board wipe potential. The goal is to overwhelm opponents with large threats and mana advantage, controlling the board and ultimately winning through the sheer power of Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on using ramp spells and mana acceleration to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield. It also includes control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own creatures. By utilizing cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with high-cost, potent threats while maintaining a level of control over the game through spells like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Ancient Stirrings and Utopia Sprawl to consistently find and cast its key Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard, using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to cheat them into play. By combining instant reanimation with combo pieces like Fallaji Archaeologist and Leyline Binding, the deck aims to create explosive turns and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful board presence. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to control the game and protect the combo. This strategy allows the deck to be aggressive and proactive, putting pressure on the opponent while setting up powerful synergies.

The deck focuses on cycling through creatures with abilities that can trigger when they are cycled, while also disrupting your opponent's strategy with counter spells and bounce effects. The goal is to quickly fill your graveyard with creatures through cycling cards, then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield at once, overwhelming your opponent with a powerful board presence. By utilizing a combination of cycling creatures and disruptive spells, the deck aims to control the game until it can execute its combo win condition with Living End.

This deck revolves around quickly generating mana through rituals and medallions to cast multiple spells in a turn, eventually comboing off with Ral, Monsoon Mage's ability to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The key is to consistently draw through the deck with Glimpse the Impossible and Past in Flames while also generating mana efficiently. Wish allows for flexibility in finding key combo pieces, while Wrenn's Resolve helps protect the combo from disruption. Overall, the goal is to storm off and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and disruptive enchantments to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key focus is on using The One Ring to generate value and create advantage while controlling the board with powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Solitude. The deck aims to maintain a strong tempo advantage by efficiently answering threats and setting up its own win conditions. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent to quickly pressure the opponent while controlling the game with counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Negation. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and flexibility. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration help with card selection and maintaining tempo. Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat provide instant removal options. The deck aims to apply consistent pressure and disrupt opponents through a combination of aggression and control elements, while maintaining card advantage and efficient mana usage.
